gurmukhi: ਭੇਖੀ ਜੋਗਨ ਭੇਖ ਦਿਖਾੲੇ ॥ ਨਾਹਨ ਜਟਾ ਬਿਭੂਤ ਨਖਨ ਮੈ ਨਾਹਿਨ ਬਸਤ੍ਰ ਰੰਗਾੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Bhekhi Jogad Bhekh Dikhaae|| Naahan Jaataa Bibhoot Nakhanndmai Naahin Bastra Ranade||
translation: O Yogis, the believers in various guises ! You are only exhibiting the outer garb, but that Lord cannot be realized by growing matted locks, by smearing ashes, by growing nails and by wearing the dyed clothes;

gurmukhi: ਜੌ ਬਨ ਬਸੈ ਜੋਗ ਕਹੁ ਪੱੲੀਅੈ ਪੰਛੀ ਸਦਾ ਬਸਤ ਬਨ ॥ ਕੁੰਚਰ ਸਦਾ ਧੂਰ ਸਿਰ ਮੇਲਤ ਦੇਖਹੁ ਸਮਝ ਤੁਮਹੀ ਮਨ ॥
transliteration: Jau Ban Basai Jog Kauh Paeeeeai Panchhisakaa Basat Ban|| Kounchar Sadaa Dhoor Sir Melat Dekhoh Samajh Toum-himan||
translation: If the Yoga had been achieved by residing in the forest, then the birds always live in the forest; in the same way the elephant always puts the dust on his body; why do you not understand it in your mind?

gurmukhi: ਦਾਦਰ ਮੀਨ ਸਦਾ ਤੀਰਥ ਮੋ ਕਰਯੋ ਕਰਤ ੲਿਸ਼ਨਾਨਾ ॥ ਧਯਾਨ ਬਿੜਾਲ ਬਕੀ ਬਕ ਲਾਵਤ ਤਿਨ ਕਿਅਾ ਜੋਗੁ ਪਛਾਨਾ ॥
transliteration: Daadar Meen Sadaa Teerath Mo Daryo Karat Ishnaanaa|| Dhyaan Bidaal Bakibak Laavat Tin Keea Jog(u) Pachhaadaa||
translation: The frogs and fish always take bath at the pilgrim-stations, the cats and cranes are always seen meditating, but still they had not recognized Yoga;

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਕਸ਼ਟ ਠਗਨ ਕਹ ਠਾਟਤ ਅੈਸੇ ਹਰਿ ਹਿਤ ਕੀਜੈ ॥ ਤਬਹੀ ਮਹਾਂ ਗਯਾਨ ਕੋ ਜਾਨੈ ਪਰਮ ਪਯੂਖਹਿ ਪੀਜੈ ॥੨੪॥੯੮॥
transliteration: Jaise Kasht Thagad Kah Thaatat Aise Har(i) Hit Keejai|| Tab-himahaan Gyaan Ko Jaanai Param Payookhah(i) Peejai||24||98||
translation: The manner in which your suffer agony for deceiving the people, in the same way make effort to absorb you mind in the Lord; only then you will realise the Supreme Essence and would be able to quaff the nectar.24.98.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਨਿ ਸੁਨਿ ਅੈਸੇ ਬਚਨ ਸਿਯਾਨੇ ॥ ੳੁਠ ੳੁਠ ਮਹਾਂ ਬੀਰ ਪਾਰਸ ਕੇ ਪਾੲਿਨ ਸੌ ਲਪਟਾਨੇ ॥
transliteration: Soun(i) Soun(i) Aise Bachanndsiyaane|| Outh Outh Mahaan Beer Paaras Ke Paain Sau Laptaane||
translation: Hearing such wise words all the great hermits with matted locks clung to the feet of Parasnath;

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਜੇ ਹੁਤੇ ਮੂੜ ਅਗਿਅਾਨੀ ਤਿਨ ਤਿਨ ਬੈਨ ਨ ਮਾਨੇ ॥ ੳੁਠ ੳੁਠ ਲਗੇ ਕਰਨ ਬਕਬਾਦਹ ਮੂਰਖ ਮੁਗਧ ੲਿਅਾਨੇ ॥
transliteration: Je Je Houte Moond Agiaanitntin Bain Na Maane|| Outh Outh Lage Karan Bakhaadah Moondakhmougadh Iaane||
translation: Those who were foolish and ignorant, they did not accept the words of Parasnath and those fools, getting up, began to make an argument with Parasnath;

gurmukhi: ੳੁਠ ੳੁਠ ਭਜੇ ਕਿਤੇ ਕਾਨਨ ਕੋ ਕੇਤਕਿ ਜਲਹਿ ਸਮਾਨੇ ॥ ਕੇਤਕ ਭੲੇ ਜੁਧ ਕਹ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤ ਸੁਨਤ ਸ਼ਬਦੁ ਘਹਰਾਨੇ ॥
transliteration: Outh Outh Bhaje Kite Kaanan Kko Kitak(i) Jalah(i) Samaane|| Ketak Bhae Judh Kah Praapat Sounat Shabad(u) Ghahraane||
translation: Some of them arose and ran away towards the forest and some of them merged themselves in water; some of them prepared themselves for fighting;

gurmukhi: ਕੇਤਕ ਅਾਨ ਅਾਨ ਸਨਮੁਖਿ ਭੲੇ ਕੇਤਕ ਛੋਰਿ ਪਰਾਨੇ ॥ ਕੇਤਕ ਜੂਝ ਸੋਭੇ ਰਣ ਮੰਡਲ ਬਾਸਵ ਲੋਕ ਸਿਧਾਨੇ ॥੨੫॥੯੯॥
transliteration: Ketak Aan Aan Sanmoukh(i) Bhae Ketak Chhodh(i) Paraane|| Ketak Joojh Sobhe Ran Mandal Baasav Lok Sidhaane||25||99||
translation: Some of them came in front of the king and some of them ran away from that place; many of them went away to heaven after fighting in the battlefield.25.99.

gurmukhi: ਜਬ ਹੀ ਸੰਖ ਸ਼ਬਦ ਘਹਰਾੲੇ ॥ ਜੇ ਜੇ ਹੁਤੇ ਸੂਰ ਜਟਧਾਰੀ ਤਿਨ ਤਿਨ ਤੁਰੰਗ ਨਚਾੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Jab Hisankh Shabad Ghahraae|| Je Je Houte Soor Jatdhaaritin Tin Turan Nachaae||
translation: When the conch of war was blown, then all the warriors with matted locks caused the dancing of their horses;
